39415360.review:
i know other people have mentioned this, but this game really does remind me of OFF; everything from the ambient soundtrack, down to the crude, sketchy artstyle of the characters/enemies. the plot is a bit on the simple side, but there are some incredibly heartwrenching/disturbing moments interwoven into it that threw me for a loop.

the characters are pretty well written and each one feels unique. they all have their own strengths, flaws, and motivations. a comment though; i know for me personally, i would have enjoyed hearing them interact with each other and the world a little bit more than they did. however, this isn't a deal breaker. what was protrayed in game was still very good and i still stand by the fact that the characters were very nicely created.

as for the battle system; it was okay. it was just the standard rpg maker stuff. a little monotonous, but not awful. the animations for the attacks were really smooth and interesting. i also did like that you had the option to not have to grind levels to do well in game. that was neat and i can't say i've ever seen that before.

as for criticism, the only real gripe i have is that it's very easy to get lost on the map. it's often hard to know what you have to do next and where you have to go to make progress. 

overall, mothlight is a really interesting eperience and i'd highly recommend checking it out.

39394152.review:
I give this game a solid 6/10, which really isn't a bad score. 

The story was intriguing, but moved too fast to build character or suspense, combat animations were really cool, but the limited attacks really nulled that point, -and the music was amazing, but sadly, there's not enough of this juicy meat on it's bones. The UI is not great, as the characters sit smack dab in front of the information. There are also items in-game which allow you to change the appearance of the character to look as though you're wearing your equipped armor set, but this could have been made automatic through Ruby. The game isn't all that difficult, and every enemy has only 1 or 2 attacks, bar some exceptions. I've pretty much butchered every boss in 6-7 hits.

Ultimately. the game's technical drawbacks and incredibly fast progression feel rushed, but aside from that, the story has some interesting moments, the art is actually really cool, but the enviroments could have had a bit more work. The music is the really what carries the game from point A to point B. Without Chez's heavily distorted guitar riffs and omnious french vocals, the world would be much more uninteresting, even with the art style and animations. 

So like I said. 6/10. If the creator ever wanted to remake this game, or pop a sequel like LISA:TPRPG, I would be more than happy to contribute funds to it. This game just screams potential, and I will gladly see what else Samu has to offer. Samu is currently doing a webcomic of sorts which I've glanced on their Discord server, if you're interested in that kind of thing.

39226396.review:
With an artstyle similar to OFF's, Mothlight is a great game with a great story,an RPG with simple mechanics,great animations and characters.
Theres little to no grinding,no leveling up,battles dont overstay and whilst they happen theyre accompanied by great music.
This is definitely up there with the great gems of RPG Maker.
For a free game this is more than you could ever ask for,if you have a couple of free hours you should play this.

My only gripe with the game is that it could do with some polish,adding some texts after certain story parts happen,other than that the game keeps its tone and immersive atmosphere up most of the time.

39165676.review:
The soundtrack alone is a perfect 10/10
If you played OFF you'll absolutely love this same aesthetic
The story had it's moments, and fighting these cool looking enemies was enjoyable
However on my first playthrough I got stuck, choosing anything other than long sword in the first area was basically beg to die to the same enemy 7 times, and after I got stuck in a later part of the game, I realized that the Dregs the bosses dropped are used to increase your max health, after I had sold all of them.

I made a new character, made the right decision to use all Dregs, and the difficulty lowered tremendously, was never overwhelmed, making the right decisions on armor and weapons and you didn't have to look at any health items.
The character walking slowly when you have to backtrack was irritating, though you could argue that it's part of the feel of the game.

Even then I still loved this experience very much, extremely worth if you are an OFF fan, or fan of any RPGmaker games
8/10

36506195.review:
I'd like to start off by mentioning that this game is completely FREE. It only takes a few hours to beat, but I would have still gladly paid a few bucks just because of the quality work and love that went into the game. In my opinion, there is no reason to NOT give this game a try, at the very least.

The characters are interesting, with great designs, (ENZO IS THE BEST) and the soundtrack is wonderfully fitting to the game's atmosphere. The combat system is fun and easy to learn, and the enemies are delightfully demented. The pacing is well-done; I only got a little lost and sidetracked from my goal a few times, but for the most part I knew what to do.

Overall, Mothlight was infinitely better than what I was expecting, and a pleasure to play. If you can bring yourself to stomach some pretty disturbing monsters and storyline, then I DEFINITELY reccomend this game.

36407572.review: I just finished the game.... im speechless. i LOVED it!! please make more games like this cause i will play them till the very end! thank you for making mothlight. :)

36399462.review:
Mothlight. I stumbled upon this game while looking for something to play one day. I didn't expect much from it, as it was a free game, but I was blown away by the quality. Enzo is fuckin' adorable.

The game is incredibly immersive, has a fairly unique storyline, and a really stylistic art style (I found it to be reminiscent of school doodles and the OFF game, actually) and the characters are all rather diverse and have interesting designs. The gameplay was enjoyable, and the battle system runs relatively smoothly and wasn't too repetitive. The game isn't too difficult to progress through as well; some bosses took me 1-3 times to beat but that was it. On another note, the music and the sound effects used were strangely good. It sounded like strange noises the first couple of times you hear it, but after that it really gets you into the game...somehow. It's weird.
Some of the flaws of the game, I'd say, were that the storyline was a bit confusing and progressed pretty fast to me (or maybe I'm just stupid lol) and there were a lot of characters and names mentioned that were kinda hard to grasp and remember their significance in the story. 

But really, that's just like one flaw I could think of. Other than that I think this game is definitely worth trying; it is pretty enjoyable. For those who like OFF, Undertale, or horror-esque/fantasy RPG maker games, this game is super neato!

35937768.review:
Mothlight - довольно необычная, сюрреалистическая игра на RPG Maker`e, с прекраснейшей мрачной стилистикой.

[h1]Сюжет.[/h1]
Игра поведает нам историю котейки по имени Энзо, чья размеренная жизнь пошла под откос, после того как он упал из Верхнего Мира в Черное море, место попав в которое живые существа становятся жидкими, а потом превращаются в металл. Вот только котейка наш не так прост, и он постарается найти способ выбраться отсюда. А попутно, разберется с сектантами, повоюет с мафией, убьет множество одичавших мутантов, грохнет Королеву Мотыльков, 3 Апостолов, и предвестника Древних Богов. Ктулху Фхтагн, как говорится! Сюжет в игре это чистейшая наркомания (в хорошем смысле слова), тут и древние боги, и жертвы изнасилований, и расчлененка в невиданных количествах, семейные драмы, отчаяние и убийства. Да что там, даже для сохранения надо найти руку торчащую из земли, и перерезать её запястья, чтобы был чекпойнт! Люди знающие английский, получат от игры еще больший кайф.

[h1]Геймплей.[/h1]
Все стандартно для игр RPG Maker`е. Мир игры довольно больший, повышений уровня персонажа нет, повышать здоровье можно получая эссенцию с убитых боссов (dreg в данном случае). Скиллы выучивается после чтения свитков. Геймплей в целом хороший.

[h1]Графика и звуки.[/h1]
Картинка в игре очень интересная, здесь этакая полулюбительская карандашная графика в стиле смешения творчеств Здзислава Бексиньского и Ганса Руди Гигера. Словами это не описать, надо смотреть. Музыка довольно хорошо подобрана.

[h1]Как итог.[/h1]
Любителям сюрреалистических игр, с сюжетом наполненным наркоманией, и необычным артом, проходить обязательно!
10 глубин сознания из 10
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1126011506

[i]P.s: если этот обзор был для Вас полезен ставьте лайк, а также добавляйтесь в друзья и подписывайтесь на меня как куратора - [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/28776273/] Обзоры онлайн [/url][/i]

35915364.review: I just finished the game and boy that was quite the trip! The story was interesting and wove together quite neatly! There are many unique characters, as well as areas in the map! While the game doesn't exactly hold your hand through the entire story, it's difficult to get off track! Though sometimes I would get off track by wandering aimlessly to see if anything changed, it was easy to know where you are supposed to be. The dialogue and interactions can be quite serious at times, but that adds to the charm of the story; the game deals with serious matters and explicit content, but it all ties in. i would like to see more attention towards this game since it was fun and easy to play, and generally a good game!

35809103.review: I DEFINITELY reccomend this game! I finished it in one playthrough because once I started I had to finish. I first got the game because I was bored and was going through an "eh, why not?" phase. I am so glad I stumbled across this game, because HOLY CRAP I WAS NOT EXPECTING IT. At first I thought it would be another crap indie game, but it's clear how much effort was put into the game from the beginning. The art style is simpler than other games, but it's definitely one of the charms to it. There's no grinding aspect, which is one thing that I was expecting. I love the free roam and exploration, and the party dynamics (Norby is my favorite in the whole game- besides from THE FROG MAN anyway!) The dark themes were just enough to give it that deep and sad undertone without being too heavy. Once, again, I massively reccomend this game and heavily encourage you to try it out! You won't be disappointed.

35486989.review: Adored the bleak and original setting of the game and the characters were definitely neat, leaves me wondering what of this universe will be used in the other games.

35467673.review:
This is such a strange game...

The universe is very unique. Graphics might be unsettling for some (they are very simple, dark, and can also be a tad bit gore at times, but nothing too mean), yet they have an amazing evocating power, and they render the whole universe very well.
Music is very basic but it suits the universe very well too.
It plays like your normal turn-based RPG (battles are reminiscent of Earthbound actually), bosses aren't that difficult... 
As far as I know, the story is... interesting, I guess. I'm not too far yet so I cannot say much on this point.

It might feel like a so-so review - actually, it is not. I just can't understand why I am so attracted to this game - just like a moth is attracted towards light... It has this little undetermined "something" that will make you want to push forward to the end.

Would recommend if you're curious to explore another strange world :) Also, it is free, so why not give it a try?

I love the creepy art style and charecter designs. There is no reason why you should not get this game, its free and takes up little storage and has a great soundtrack.

35291503.review: An adventure that shouldn't be missed. Strange world full of interesting characters.

35278811.review:
Despite having some technical mistakes and limitations (I will address them later) and a certain lack of a final polish, Mothlight certainly felt like it was made by someone who really like games, and that's great.

The hand drawn sprites, the little custom animations in every skill, and to a bigger extent the music, made me feel that this game had a soul. I felt dread; disgust; anger. Only games that were cared about end up evoking emotions like that. The music was pretty on point with the concept. It really helped with the ambience and setting the mood for some fights. It wasn't always like this though, but in general it went pretty well.

There were, however, some technical issues with some of the design that made me unconfortable: stylistical incongruences, using both "normal" pixel art tilesets and the hand drawn sprites. It indeed gave the game some color, but I feel like it didnt quite hit the mark in this aspect. Another thing is the lack of clear directions, giving some sort of Dark Souls-ish tips instead. I love Dark Souls so this didn't really bother me that much, but to other people, it might be frustrating.

I'm a sucker for RPG Maker games in general, so I might be a little biased in this review, but I really liked what I saw and heard here. I'm looking forward for more work like this.

Great job!

35249765.review:
It is a great game, although, the story seems to dominate all.  Here is a list of what I saw in my first playthrough:

1. There is no such thing as xp, don't expect to level up at all.  Use the dreg herbs and shards to increase health an rage.

2. Enzo (the character you play) gets pretty op quite early in the game (Choose the long sword and you will see what I mean).

3. Be prepared to read and explore, the game kind of depends on this.  The gameplay is nothing special, but by golly is the story deep.

4. Your party can't seem to equip anything other than rings and bracelets.

5. Be warned, there are boobs and slight nudity, but convinient shadows are present.  Just don't play at work or in school.

6. For a free game, it is great.  It will definately take up at least a slow afternoon.  Highly recommend those who like the RPG genre and love detailed pixel art.

34909616.review: Honestly, all i can say is that you NEED to play this game! I don't want to spoil it for you guys, but this was quite a journey for the 6.7 hours i did. Yes this game is very dark at some moments, but it is also very cute. I also liked how you added yourself in the game in the club/bar. You know what i mean. I really do wish i knew french, so i can listen to the main song, and now what it means <3 After beating this game without counting me crying, or actually needed to take a few minutes to calm down and think, i was in awe. This game is so similar to OFF and kinda has the same motive if you would like to think like that? I wouldn't say its related to Undertale AT ALL, unless you want to count the goal of this game, to get up onto the overworld. Every area is different, about special in it's own way. I also love how you actually don't level up in this game, as far as i know from me playing out. Its quite funny if you ask me. MothLight is an absolutely AMAZING game.

34725144.review:
The game is a lot of fun! I had a fun time playing through all of it.
Althought there were a few issues when I first played it.

1: It's pretty easy to not die. I've only died about 3-4 times. This may do with the fact that you can avoid fights with enemies when going through levels, but that's up to how people play the game. 

2: The Bosses and Enemies aren't that hard to defeat. Sure, a few of the bosses were a little stronger than the common enemies in the game, but once you learn how to use Gospel and keep using cigarettes on a certain level, it makes the game easy.
 
3: Allies are very weak. The ability to not change armor on your allies takes away from that, even Norby (who is the weakest of the group) has no armour to give whatsoever that can be applied.

4: Bracelets and Rings don't do much. Although it's a good addition for extra stats, they don't really provide much for fighting enemies. Much is reliant on the Armour and Weapons. The stats are a good idea, but don't have much of an effect on the fighting. The only one that does matter is the Luck stat, which gives the player a higher chance to attack first, but none of the other stats provide much.

Besides everything I've said, I really enjoyed this game. Brought back some good memories when I was playing OFF. Great work!

34722504.review: This game is probally one of the best free games on the market

34709639.review:
Love this game so much! I'll be honest, since it's free, I wasn't expecting anything extraordinary. But the story is engaging and easy to follow, the worldbuilding really draws you in, and the atmosphere is amazing - both the artstyle of the characters and the awesome noise rock & acoustic soundtrack really give the game the kick it needs. Not sure if there will actually be two endings [spoiler] (join Neethan or not) [/spoiler] but if there are I'd be more than willing to play it several times over.

Of course, however, there are some issues with it. It's not that difficult to beat enemies and get better equipment, which wouldn't be a problem if it were to a lesser degree, but I was able to pass the first 3 bosses without upgrading my health at all (since I didn't know dregs are a health upgrade item). Also, the environments are sometimes a little lacking artistically, being composed of mostly solid color blocks; and while this doesn't detract from the experience, there could be a little more detail in them. 

Finally, a bug I found. After I [spoiler] beat the Moth Queen and was wandering around trying to find the next arcane rune enemy [/spoiler], my down key suddenly got stuck, rendering the game pretty much unplayable because I can't walk upwards. This isn't just my computer, because it isn't stuck on any Word files or anything like that. Whatever the issue ends up being, I hope it gets fixed soon so that I can continue playing this wonderful RPG. :)

Thank you for making this awesome game!

34697626.review:
Incredible! 
Mothlight is a free, avant-garde RPG maker game that really surprised me with how atmospheric and fun it is. Especially since most RPG Maker games get a bad rap.

The game is very reminiscent of stuff like OFF and Dark Souls, with even some LISA in the mix, but I think it personally managed to stay pretty unique.

The gameplay is typical RPG Maker battle stuff, but it has amazing animations and interesting skills. While the combat is extremely easy (I think I died 2 times in my entire playthrough which was ~4hrs) it was still addicting. There is no LVL'ing either, grinding for $$$ is optional.

The music, my boy, the music. The soundtrack (which has 3 hours of music) is filled with bizzare melancholic sounds from experimental post/math-rock to melodically strong or confused rock peices, it was super atmopsheric and my ears loved it. I did have to turn my volume down sometimes, cause it gets really screechy. (Although the labyrinth song I could hear that it was made with that Music Maker website which made me cringe a bit.)

The story, which is mostly a lot of Dark Souls level pretentious lore, is understandable if you pay attention closely which I liked. What I didn't like, however, was how characters would just outright and cringely explain to you what was happening and why. Sometimes the player can infer for themselves, and the characters writing sometimes sounded like "Here is what to think player, because you might be to unobservant to think about it!". The writing was good in some spots but for the most part it was very okay. I think the key to writing is to make it sound like what a human being would say, and it unfortunately read off artificial. The characters were okay too, except for their designs: they were great and well done. Over-all, it didn't get in the way for me because of all the great things it did. But I recommend building up your writing skills, Samu. ;)

The art reminded me so much of SUITS: A Business RPG to the point where I thought it was the same developer from the steam screenshots. For the overworld: pixel. For the characters and battles: hand-drawn style. I liked the animations the most about the art. It was really well done.

The world design is great! Each area had great colors, atmosphere, and "decor". It was fun to explore the depths and the heights of the world.

But most of all, the game is FREE. A lot of effort was put into this game too. And there is No cost in trying it except for time. 

And it IS worth your time. So try it out. 
Thank you for making it SAMU, it was a joy to experience, and I hope it motivates you to make more, I'll be following your work.

Also the soundtrack is available on Bandcamp via Monplaisir & Cie. <-- #lit

8.5/10.
p.s., Samu, it's me, PieNinjaProductions

34640298.review:
Ah.. now this is a game I won't mind reviewing in a postive way. (Spoilers, It's going to be a 'good' review.) You play as a cat called Enzo, you're a dredge, what's a dredge you might ask? Simple, a criminal cast down into something similar to hell, or purgatory,  at first you might be a little confused or familar of how the game runs hell If I had to make a skimmed comparison I'd have to say the art style works based comparably to OFF.

The art is good, the characters actually have backbone, hell even the enemies do, I didn't realize (Spoilers) [spoiler]my one companion for about five minutes was going to be a complete and total crazed mass murderer.[/spoiler]

The music, that's another part which I honestly enjoy, It brings that sense of thrill, the action of how combat and scenery unfolds, the music practically breathes life into the game and It does it pretty well at that.

Equipment, somewhat similar to off in comparison, weapon slot, shield, armor, bracelet, and ring might not have much at first but you'll find yourself with a pretty good selection later on in the game  (Having not finished it myself It's safe to assume theres more than 7-10 with stats based on your progression, tldr, farther is better.)

The combat is your standard run of the mill TBC (or turn based combat for those who don't know.) You take a turn, then your enemies do, you can find more party members but expect them to be temporary because for the sake of story, [spoiler]some of them are actually going to die.[/spoiler] 

As for lore? I've never seen an indie game have so much, criminals being cast down into the black sea and those that don't fall in the sea are called the dredge.. that 'can' go feral and start killing people on a whim, It's a game you need to experience for yourself to enjoy, like it or not.


As for combat however, you gain coins, not exp, when you kill a major area enemy you get something similar to a health upgrade (Blue dredge soul or stone.) You find dredge herbs to increase your rage (Skill/mana limit) By 5 each time you find one. Later on you can find dredge shards and if you find three you increase your max hp. 

For gear more or less don't be surprised if you take zero damage later on [spoiler]unless you're being dealt poison condition damage -cough-[/spoiler]  

The skills have good context, some have more use than others, hell theres even a skill called Vicious Meowing what's not fun about that? Did I also say that you're a cat? 

Some enemies will take a little longer to kill while others you can actually farm for coins In example, sand worms later on.

Heard the game's short,  haven't finished it yet though I do have to admit this will be a good game to spend a boring day with because you'll be into that like a burrito with cheese on taco tuesday.


[h1]In conclusion[/h1]

This game has good lore, music, gameplay, It's similar to off with it's own style and perspective and In my own specific opinion enjoyable to come across with a dark turn at times.

[b]I can't help to admit I actually like the game, normally most reviews I post are for utter garbage but this? Seems we found some good quality! 8/10 Give it a try![/b]

34543054.review:
I am writing this review because I do want other people to play this game and there is not many reviews due to the glitch where it will not track how many hours you have in the game (I actually have 3 to 4 hours in game). 

Pros: 
-Free
-Decent story for an RPG
-Nice music (my favorite song is labyrinth)
-Not grindy (Most RPGs require you to spend time grinding in order to get enough xp to survive)

Cons:
-Bugs (like the steam not tracking how much in game hours, some wall collider issues, and xp is never given (don't know if this is done on purpose))
-Sometimes you might get lost (I couldn't figure out where the 3rd boss was in order to reach the final boss)
-Balancing issues (Enzo is basically invincible once he gets the best armor and his party members die easily)

Overall this game is a nice game to enjoy for a couple hours and would be better if it was polished out a little bit more.

34517214.review:
Most of the issues have now been fixed and I have changed the review to positive after finishing it.

First off, the game tries way too hard to be OFF and doesn't succeed.
The game doesn't tell you pretty much anything, so unless a pure coincidence happens, you specifically ask the developer or complain, you will never get past a certain part in the game.
However, once you figure out how stuff works, the game is very easy. Way too easy, in fact. You can get the best armor in the game about halfway through and money is not an issue at all.
There is no leveling system, which I applaud for being original. However, the "EXP earned" box still shows up and the progression is based solely off the items you get. Which you can't do for the rest of your party.
Enemy encounters aren't random, they just stand in-place. They don't drop EXP and money isn't an issue so why fight them? There's no reason to, so I just skipped most of them.
The music was really good, while the art ranged from good to awful. While the artist is good at drawing eldritch monstrosities, he's not very familiar with drawing actual people with proper anatomy, which gives them a very deviantart-ish feel.
There was an attempt at being funny, but it failed. Pug enemies that fart on you, random animu noises or a frog that says "I am frog man" isn't funny, it's a poor attempt at "lol so random" comedy, which I feel should've just been completely scrapped.
There's a couple of interesting characters, but most of them die. My favorite was the dog party member, even though he was weak as hell. As for the bad characters, there's a self-insert teenager with a hoodie that increases your max rage (mana) when given a certain item. Quite ironic, since rage is the exact expression I felt when I saw him or her on my screen.
At one point a really annoying character gets stuck in your party and you don't have a say in it. She was so edgy I thought she was going to cut herself, and I wish I could have just killed her or gotten rid of her. Actually the entire game is pretty edgy, unlike OFF. There's a lot of swearing and nudity all over the game with absolutely no subtelty, going as far as rape or sex slaves.
There is a drug in the game and you're told that you shouldn't take because something bad will happen, so after beating the game I reloaded my last save and beat the incredibly monotonous and impossible to lose final boss but with the drug. There was no change to the ending, which by the way is very bad and again, you don't have a say in it.
There's a couple of small issues, like most objects that stand out not being interactable or the character sprites being in the way of the stats. The game's very short, you can probably beat it in a single afternoon if you know what you're doing. My entire playtime wasn't recorded due to a bug that was fixed afterwards, but it only was like 4 or 5 hours evem with not knowing what to do most of the time.
Still, I reccomend it because it feels like Samu actually tried and was very friendly when talking with me. Also because it's free, which doesn't shield it from criticism, but has to be considered.
But OFF is still better and also free.

Original review: https://pastebin.com/RQybzMWQ

34516132.review: This is the first review for the game it would seem so I'll try my best to be thorough. Despite this I recommend anyone who loves old style RPG as this game is diffently well made and I've enjoyed far more then I have most other F2P games. I must also mention that there may or may not be some bugs (I don't get any EXP from killing things which may be a bug but other then that there is nothing else) and the window for the game is small and unchangeable.

39546880.review:
This game is one I would point to when people start slamming RPGMaker as a tool, along with LISA and the Medieval Cop games. Great things can be done with even one of the most accessible maker tools. 

Yes, the combat is your standard RPGMaker fare, but that works for me. The only gripe I had about the combat was that sometimes that character graphics would cover my stats and I wouldn't always know I needed to heal or top of my character's rage. 

The hand done graphics and imagery was disturbing in the best possible way. The mutated characters invoke more comparisons to LISA, but the context of the story and the way those mutations are handled make sure that it is inspired, not copied. The animations were reasonably smooth.

The soundtrack was near perfect. It was one of the first things that struck me about the game. It captures the tone, moods and themes of the game and story quite well. If it was available for separate download, I would certainly snag it.

The story was simple but very rich. The world had a variety of places and characters. It was complex without being overbearing.

I would have happily paid for this game. It's currently free so do yourself a favour and check it out!

39528777.review: Mothlight is surprisingly long and detailed for a free game. Color me impressed.
